abstract: CBS led during ever time slot of the night, broadcasting its standard fare of summer programming: repeats of “Million Dollar Password” at 8 p.m. (6.5 million), “Cold Case” at 9 p.m. (6.4 million), and “Without a Trace” at 10 p.m. (5.5 million).
snippet: CBS led during ever time slot of the night, broadcasting its standard fare of summer programming: repeats of “Million Dollar Password” at 8 p.m. (6.5 million), “Cold Case” at 9 p.m. (6.4 million), and “Without a Trace” at 10 p.m. (5.5 million).
lead_paragraph: The CBS veteran newsmagazine “60 Minutes” delivered the top network television ratings on Sunday, attracting 8.5 million viewers at 7 p.m., according to Nielsen’s estimates.
